ML_AA_NAMES.AA_NAME: Ministry of Defence, Land Equipment, Other

ORGANISATION.OFFICIALNAME: Ministry of Defence, Land Equipment, Other

TITLE_CONTRACT.P: Provision of Whole Aircraft Charter for the Transportation of Military and Government Cargo and Personnel Worldwide

SHORT_CONTRACT_DESCRIPTION.P: Non-scheduled air transport services. Air-charter services. Hire of aircraft with crew. Hire of fixed-wing aircraft with crew. Hire of helicopters with crew. The Authority has a requirement for whole aircraft charter for the transportation of military cargo and personnel worldwide. The Authority requires the ability to access commercial aircrafts in order to augment its military fleet in times of operational surge or to transport exceptional loads. Suppliers are required to provide flexible access to the commercial whole aircraft charter market in a dynamic and fast moving military environment.
The requirement has been split into four Lots:

There is no limit to the number of Lots a supplier may apply to tender for. Suppliers may apply for one Lot only (except Lot 2) or for more than one Lot. In order to apply for Lot 2 – Cargo Emergency, suppliers must successfully apply for Lot 1 Cargo. Suppliers cannot apply for Lot 2 only.
Framework agreements will be awarded for each Lot.

LOT_DESCRIPTION.P: For the movement of cargo worldwide. Cargo may be palletised or loose-loaded and may include outsized loads such as helicopters, armoured vehicles and other specialised military equipment which can include IATA-compliant Dangerous Goods classes 1-9 and firearms. Suppliers will be expected to provide all licences and clearances to allow this. At times, and in conjunction with the Authority, licenses may be required to move non-IATA compliant Dangerous Goods.

TOTAL_QUANTITY_OR_SCOPE.P: This will be a framework agreement with several operators, it is expected that there will be a maximum of 5 operators.
The method of award under this framework will be further competition.
There is no commitment or guarantee of work for any suppliers under the framework agreements.
The initial duration of all framework agreements will be 4 years with options to extend for a maximum of an additional 3 years.
Limitations of the number of operators who will be invited to tender for Lot 1 – it is envisaged that there will be a minimum of 7 and a maximum of 10.

LOT_DESCRIPTION.P: For the movement of cargo (as described in Lot 1 above) worldwide at very short notice.

TOTAL_QUANTITY_OR_SCOPE.P: This will be a framework agreement with a single operator.
The method of award under this framework will be direct award.
There is no commitment or guarantee of work for the supplier under the framework agreement.
The initial duration of the framework agreement will be 4 years with options to extend for a maximum of an additional 3 years.
In order to apply to tender for Lot 2 – Cargo Emergency, suppliers must successfully apply for Lot 1 Cargo. Suppliers cannot apply for Lot 2 only.
Limitations of the number of operators who will be invited to tender for Lot 1 and Lot 2 combined – it is envisaged that there will be a minimum of 7 and a maximum of 10.

LOT_DESCRIPTION.P: For the movement of passengers worldwide. Passenger moves can be for groups of mainly service personnel but they may also include service families/dependents, unaccompanied minors, detainees with a nominated escort, fee paying passengers and other government personnel. Passenger moves can also include the transportation of deceased personnel. Suppliers will be expected to provide all licences and clearances to allow this. At times this may also include carriage of IATA-compliant Dangerous Goods Class 1-9 and firearms.

TOTAL_QUANTITY_OR_SCOPE.P: This will be a framework agreement with several operators, it is expected that there will be a maximum of 5 operators.
The method of award under this framework will be further competition.
There is no commitment or guarantee of work for any suppliers under the framework agreements.
The initial duration of all framework agreements will be 4 years with options to extend for a maximum of an additional 3 years.
Limitations of the number of operators who will be invited to tender for Lot 3 – it is envisaged that there will be a minimum of 7 and a maximum of 10.

LOT_DESCRIPTION.P: For the movement of an individual or small groups of passengers at immediate notice, to support the Joint Casualty and Compassionate Centre.

TOTAL_QUANTITY_OR_SCOPE.P: This will be a framework agreement with several operators, it is expected that there will be a maximum of 5 operators.
The method of award under this framework will be further competition.
There is no commitment or guarantee of work for any suppliers under the framework agreements.
The initial duration of all framework agreements will be 4 years with options to extend for a maximum of an additional 3 years.
Limitations of the number of operators who will be invited to tender for Lot 4 – it is envisaged that there will be a minimum of 7 and a maximum of 10.
There is no commitment or guarantee of work for any suppliers under the framework agreements.
The initial duration of all framework agreements will be 4 years with options to extend for a maximum of an additional 3 years.
The estimated Value ranges specified in this notice are based on the maximum contract duration of 7 years.

OPTION_DESCRIPTION.P: The initial duration of all framework agreements will be 4 years with options to extend for a maximum of an additional 3 years.

ADDITIONAL_INFORMATION.P: The Contracting Authority considers that this contract may be suitable for economic operators that are small or medium enterprises (SMEs). However, any selection of tenderers will be based solely on the criteria set out for the procurement.The Authority reserves the right to amend any condition related to security of information to reflect any changes in national law or government policy. If any contract documents are accompanied by instructions on safeguarding classified information (e.g. a Security Aspects Letter), the Authority reserves the right to amend the terms of these instructions to reflect any changes in national law or government policy, whether in respect of the applicable protective marking scheme, specific protective markings given, the aspects to which any protective marking applies, or otherwise. The link below to the Gov.uk website provides information on the Government Security Classification.

The Cyber risk profile for the framework agreements is Low. Operators which are invited to tender will be required to complete the Supplier Assurance Questionnaire (SAQ) via the Supplier cyber protection service (Octavian) to demonstrate their compliance with the required cyber risk level.
Advertising Regime OJEU:- This contract opportunity is published in the Official Journal of the European Union (OJEU),the MoD Defence Contracts Bulletin and www.contracts.mod.uk.
Suppliers must read through this set of instructions and follow the process to respond to this opportunity.
The information and/or documents for this opportunity are available on http://www.contracts.mod.uk

You must register on this site to respond, if you are already registered you will not need to register again, simply use your existing username and password. Please note there is a password reminder link on the homepage.
Suppliers must log in, go to your Response manager and add the following Access Code: 2U4YP2QG5S.
Please ensure you follow any instruction provided to you here.

The deadline for submitting your response(s) is detailed within this contract notice, you will also have visibility of the deadline date, once you have added the Access Code via DCO as the opening and closing date is visible within the opportunity.
Please ensure that you allow yourself plenty of time when responding to this opportunity prior to the closing date and time, especially if you have been asked to upload documents.

If you experience any difficulties please refer to the online Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ’s) or the User Guides or contact the MOD DCO Helpdesk by emailing support@contracts.mod.uk or Telephone 0800 282 324.

ORGANISATION.OFFICIALNAME: Ministry of Defence, Land Equipment, Other
